servinfo.title: Description of Cruise Control System Cancel Conditions
servinfo.ptxt: Constant cruising is cancelled under the following conditions.

item.ptxt: Vehicle speed becomes lower than minimum operating speed (36 km/h (22 mile/h)).
Vehicle speed fails approx 20% from preset speed.
Transfer switch is positioned to other position than “4H” and “4HL” (motor-shift type 4WD model).
*Brake pedal is depressed. (Brake light switch is turned ON).
*Clutch pedal is depressed (Clutch pedal position switch is turned ON) (M/T model).
*Selector lever is shifted to other range than “D”, “3” (4 A/T model) and “4” (5 A/T model) range (A/T model).

attention3.ptxt: When constant cruising is cancelled under any condition with * (asterisk), vehicle speed before cancellation can be resumed by operating RES/ACC switch, provided that vehicle speed is higher than 40 km/h (25 mile/h).
